subject: Economics
title: Barter: The Myth of the Original Economy
description: A 60-second lesson on Barter: The Myth of the Original Economy.

hook.text: Textbooks say we bartered before money â€” I'll trade you fish for wheat. Anthropologists say that never happened.

buildup.text: David Graeber studied hundreds of societies. None used barter as their primary system of exchange.

discovery.text: Instead, people used gift economies and social debt â€” I help you now, you owe me later. Trust, not trade.

twist.text: The barter myth was invented by Adam Smith in 1776. He made it up to explain why money was necessary.

climax.text: Money didn't replace barter. It replaced complex webs of social obligation with something portable.

punchline.text: The origin story of money is itself a fiction.

quiz.question: According to anthropologists, what did money actually replace?
